text:
Using apache-1.3.35, when I try: "#apachectl configtest"
I get this error:

Syntax error on line XX of /path/to/included/file2:
Missing </VirtualHost> directive at end-of-file


file2 is inluded from from file1. 
file1 looks like:
Listen www.example.com:80
<VirtualHost www.example.com:80>
    SSLDisable
    ServerName     www.example.com
    ServerAdmin    webmaster@example.com

    include /path/to/included/file2

</VirtualHost>

file2 only have some rewrite rules.

With apache-1.3.34 this error doesn't happen
creator: guilleva@gmail.com
jorton@redhat.com
text: *** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 39490 ***

This is being un-dupped; the two errors are really unrelated (wildcards,
and nesting).  The patch is backed out for 1.3.36 forthcoming release,
but in terms of resolving the feature into a working patch, this group
of cases should remain independent of Include {} wildcard matching.
creator: wrowe@apache.org
wrowe@apache.org
text:
See bugs 39531 snd 39545 for duplicates, as well as possibly 39513 for possibly
a deep traceback of what could be triggering the problem.

creator: wrowe@apache.org
text:
As much as we would like to tell you this is fixed, with the subdirectory
feature from 1.3.35 retained - the answer was to back out that patch.

This regression from 1.3.34 is resolved in 1.3.36, sans Include subdir/
new feature :(

creator: dave@convio.com
text:
Depending on the exact set of include files, I found either the reported error,
with a line number beyond the end of the file in question, or a segfault.
(RHAS 3 update 5, gcc-3.2.3)

Glad to have it confirmed that I'm not crazy :-)
